description:
Medium soy latte; Mushroom & spinach egg wrap; 
Avocado, spinach, & banana smoothie; Jalapeño cream cheese & cucumber everything bagel
author: Amanda T.

description:
It's like someone was hitting the woman in the back of the head with a frying pan as I asked her a question. 

She was there, and then she wasn't there. After I asked a question she would stare off into space, divert her eyes and become unresponsive. 

I'm not sure if my questioning was really difficult, like, what is the difference between a blended and non blended chi tea or if she just didn't want to deal with customers who didn't know exactly what they want. 

Whatever, it turn me off, with the 50 coffee shops within 1 a mile radius I won't come back to this one. 

The pastery was day old, the drinks were not so good and the service was as mentioned. 

Oh, and the cops hang out here.
author: Ben M.

description:
Cash only. They charge for extra cream cheese and by judging the bagel I ordered, anyone and everyone will be needing extra cream cheese. It was very disappointing opening up my bagel at home and seeing how scarcely they use their cream cheese. Unless you want to always pay for "extra" cream cheese. 

The Green Tea Latte was really good tho.
author: Claudine R.

description:
CASH ONLY!! Somehow my friend missed this when he picked this place and so we found ourselves doing an ATM walk of shame across the street. 

Ordered: Turkey Pesto Special Sandwich & Chai Tea Latte
+ Great portion of food
+ Super yummy - the cream cheese has a very strong flavor/after taste so be prepared but it was delicious
+ Best Chai Tea Latte I've ever had - the woman was cute and helped me pick it

Also, the woman gave my friend and I a free taste of the avocado smoothie. Great customer service!!
author: Isaac A.

description:
I came for the matcha green tea latte and was pleasantly surprised to learn that it comes with a shot of espresso if you so desire. I ordered mine as a small (12 oz) with almond milk for an extra charge and the grand total came out to $4.15. The taste was interesting, but it grew on me and would totally order it again!

The only reason this spot gets downgraded by one star is the EXTREMELY slow service. It wasn't a big deal for me this time as I came to this cafe to catch up with a friend. However, it took a good 10-15 mins for our drinks to get to us, even though there wasn't really much of a line. I saw many customers waiting up front to get their drinks so they could leave. They need to find a way to get it together so service is delivered in a more timely manner.

Parking was fairly easy (and free!) on a Sunday morning, ~10AM.

VERY IMPORTANT: Cash only.
author: Michelle K.

description: please take into account my review with a bit of a caveat; i am not a coffee drinker, but i did order their croissant breakfast sandwich and strawberry banana smoothie. first, the sandwich was decent. the croissant had a nice crisp to it, the egg had a nice, slight pepper sprinkle to it, and the cheese complimented it well. the problem - while i'm a big fan of breakfast sandwiches like it, it felt a bit thrown together and the bacon...the bacon wasn't crisp. your boy likes crispy bacon. while the sandwich fulfilled my hunger, it was the smoothie that earned the 2-star rating. oh man, it was not good. in order to get the strawberry flavor, they seem to use the strawberry syrup from what you might find on an ice cream sundae. consequently, it was super sweet. i like smoothies; that was not good.
author: Mike C.

description: Tasty, speedy coffee and very good sandwiches. Their staff is very polite. I recommend the BLT. They have light delicious bread for their inexpensive sandwiches that are great for on the go or a picnic. They play classical music and have nice seating outside and in. Cash only!
author: Tracey H.

description: The staff are friendly. The egg bagel was yummy. Very quaint though could really use a wipe down. Reasonably priced and quick.
author: Siobhan M.

description:
I'm so glad I accidently stopped by this place. I really love their breakfast sandwiches and all the drinks that I've had so far are delicious. Did I tell you about the staff? Oh man.. they are the sweetest ladies Everytime I come in. Today was a great treat because I got to meet Ann. Which I'm sure is the owner. She got me to try coconut mocha. I told her how I don't like coconut, but she said it was different because it's real coconut. 
I'm glad I did! Very subtle coconut flavor and after taste. Was not a strong espresso flavor which is what I personally like. 

I usually get the vanilla chai, it has a yummy spicy flavor that is rounded out with vanilla. Gorgeous flavor. 

As for the sandwiches, you cant go wrong. The other day I had asiago with pesto garlic cream cheese and tomato. Mmmmm so good!

I've also had their spinach, cheese and ham or bacon. My favorites

Definitely go here. But look for parking around the corner.
author: Patricia A.

description:
I love little hole in the wall restaurants like this.  You never know the level of creativity & care they put into their food until you walk in.  If you want grab-and-go quick premade stuff....go elsewhere.  If you want beautiful, delicious, & carefully prepared food at a great price...eat here.  

I got the egg spinach mushroom wrap and it was so good.  I had to ask them if they made their own salsa because it seemed so fresh.

Later that same day:  had to go back for lunch/dinner it was that good.  Yes that salsa is fresh!  The avocado smoothie.  The avocado smoothie.  So good it will haunt me all week!
author: Jim H.

description:
Meh. It is a small establishment, which is usually fine, but you have to come here specifically to be in and out. With no bathroom and no outlets, it's not a good spot to come to work (which is what I came here to do).

Needless to say, the coffee is fairly well priced (on par with Starbucks) but not much better. It's self pour, which I normally don't mind but I think the brew had been sitting out for quite a while because it didn't taste fresh.

I like that it's a cozy, local spot but that's about it.
author: Lee L.

description:
Rude service. Owner was not welcoming at all, and food was so-so. Do not recommend. CASH ONLY 

FOOD: I got a bagel with tomato and hammus ($4.20). It was freshly made (which means warm) and tasted okay, but it was very simple and something that I could have easily made. 

SERVICE: My friend and I came here to study and grab a snack. As soon as we sat down, the owner shouted from the counter DEMANDING (not even asking) if we are buying thing. RUDE. Yes we are going to get things. Just give us some time to settle down, lady!!! So I went up and got a bagel. And as soon as I finished my order, she asked (more like demanded) if my friend was getting something too. Eh, what? She was also very cold when I asked for a fork. We stayed there for a few hours. 5 minutes before they were closing, the lady shouted (again from the counter) while pointing to the clock, that they are closing in a very rude voice. 

However, there is a Malaysian (? or Singapore) server who was very kind and welcoming, and thanked the customer every 5 seconds. He should consider working for someone nicer. 

SETTING: Shop is located very close to UCSF and GG Park. There are 4-5 small tables inside, and 2-3 tables on the outside. There is NO bathroom. 

PRICE: Overpaid for the food and more importantly, the service. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I've never felt so unwelcomed at a cafe before. People go to cafes to relax, not to be shouted at.
author: Wendy F.

description: Breakfast sandwiches are amazing! It's a cute little area right across from Golden Gate Park and the wait staff is very very friendly. We just moved here from Brooklyn New York and haven't had the opportunity for a good bagel sandwich until we came to this place! Reminds us of home!
author: Sara D.

description:
Went here for breakfast and coffee. It's near a shuttle stop so pretty convent if the shuttle's late and I'm hungry.

It's cash only so come prepared.

The hazelnut latte was more creamy than anything else. You could barely taste the coffee in it... The coffee was also really hot - hot enough that I had to stop after a block to rest my hand. This probably has more to do with the sleeve they use than the coffee temperature since I could drink it just fine.

I also got an egg, cheddar, and bacon sandwich on a croissant. You can get your egg sandwiches on a croissant or a bagel. They heated up the croissant but not by toasting it... It was pretty flat... I suspect that they microwaved it :( the egg could have used some seasoning...
author: Lily L.

description: I am glad I was finally able to try this place. This place is near the n line and other buses in the area. It's almost always open and I always get their bagel with everything with eggs&ham. It is always cooked just right. The owner is super nice and there's seating inside and outside. I will definitely come back if I am in the area.
author: Corie L.

description:
A small cozy and a sweet place, shining the holidays season ambiance, in a neighborhood that some may consider as "hippie".
Loved the welcoming and the friendliness of the owner and the waitresses there; I felt already the warmness in this rainy and cold weather.
The food was well prepared though was expecting a more authentic and unique taste.
author: Gilbert B.

description:
Poor coffee
Worst customer service 
Rude beyond belief 
Unwarranted horrible treatment from an obviously unhappy employee 
Purposely given the wrong order.
I do no recommend nor will I EVER patronize this sad excuse for a coffee shop again 
BAD BAD BAD BAD ZERO STARS
Unacceptable behavior 
If you're not happy at your job find a new one but don't be rude to someone who says "good morning, how's your day going?"
Diana Lee would be ashamed of this employee who treated not only me rudely but the people in front of me horribly too.
author: Michael S.

description:
I was volunteering at Kezar Pavilion, feenin' for some caffeine and was directed to this establishment.  It is a small, quaint and cozy cafe with a wide selection of beverages and food options, perfect for my fix.  After much deliberation, I ordered a (Dirty) Matcha Green Tea Latte and a breakfast sandwich of some sort (I don't recall the food item, but I do remember that in my starved state it was delicious).  It was the first time I'd ever ordered that drink any where and I was immediately curious as to why nobody had ever recommended this drink to me before since I love green tea and I love espresso (dirty = espresso shot).  

Having my fix and my food, I was undoubtedly pleased with my experience.
author: Michael G.

description: Super tiny is its only drawback but the coffee, tea and sandwiches are first rate at a reasonable price.
author: DiAnn A.

description: Stopped because the sign said an egg sandwich for $4.99! Wow it was delicious but the best part was the staff/owner she was super nice and sweet. Friendliest lady I've met in a long time. Her appreciation for my business made the sandwich taste great! The sandwich was delicious!!
author: Nicole C.

description:
PRO's:
-Decent prices for bagels
-They make blended drinks
-Cozy atmosphere

CON's:
-No bathroom
-Almond/Soy are 80¢ extra, which is a bit steep


My former roommate claimed this was his go-to cafe to work on his laptop and I've never really understood why. It's fine for ordering a drink or bite to go but there is no restroom, so it's unwise to linger for too long. I would come back to try something blended or sweet when I'm craving that sort of thing.

I ordered a ginger chai over ice, it was served to me warm with some ice in it. Delicious but kind of an odd temperature to consume it.
author: Megan D.

description: Decided to try this place for the first time this morning. Purchased an egg sandwich and a coffee and am pleasantly surprised how good the quality and freshness is. I will definitely be back!
author: Jason S.

description: If you're looking for racial profiling and leniency toward severe food allergies, you've found the right place. Upon specifying my dairy restrictions with the ill mannered associate, it was apparent my request was ignored due to my extreme stomach discomfort and pain that shortly followed the consumption of my drink. To top off the abhorrent experience, it was exceedingly uncomfortable to be scrutinized by both the workers and bystanders since the moment I walked through the door.
author: Emerald J.

description: Had a cream cheese avocado bagel with ice latte. Both really nice, Staff really friendly :)
author: Monika P.

description:
Two words: avocado smoothie. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

The bagels are decent (they're from Costco) but the cream cheese is great. Lots of coffee selections too, and always brewed well. Cash only, which can be annoying.
author: Hello G.

description:
Okay. I don't know exactly where to begin, so I'll start with the food. Small cafe offering coffee and sandwiches. The ginger peach tea wasn't good at all. No flavor, bland, tastes like green tea. My family and I came here on two occasions. The second time we came back because the food was good for a small cafe. 
First time I came, I ordered the turkey pesto on croissant, which typically comes with the French roll. I opted out because the roll itself was huge. The croissant wasn't greasy. Although I would say, I first asked for the Asiago cheese bagel with it and changed my mind a few seconds later. The owner, I believe, was adamant about me using the bagel because they already warmed it up and was asking anyone else with me if they wanted it. I found that very inconvenient. I get it's a small business, I own one too, however I believe in customer satisfaction. I'm assuming her son, the other person working there, said it's fine after he witnessed his mom saying that. 
Back to the food. I got jalapeño cream cheese added in as well as the pesto, and it was delicious. I like that she let us try it. Tasted quite fresh. My sister in law got it on the French roll (as it comes) and said it was good as well. Service is kind of slow since there's only one person making the food.

The second time we came back, we all ordered one by one. Sissy in law got a drink, vitamin water. After we paid for everything and sat down, I saw as my sissy in law is drinking her drink, asked her why the cap was orange. She then said it tasted funny. Turns out it expired back in October. Without making a big deal, she let one of the workers know, then grabbed another drink and proceeded to drink it. He stopped her and said the price is different and needs to pay more. Not once he apologized for it being expired, instead asked for money. I was kind of upset. I mean wouldn't you want to comp the customer because you had an expired drink from months back? That's a fine from the health department. What if she fell sick? Okay I might be exaggerating, but still. 
In the end they forgot about my twin's sandwich, he ended up getting it to-go as we were on the way to the airport. 
All in all, food is good but service is eh', and make sure to double check the expiration dates!!
author: Farah A.

description:
Came here on a Saturday morning. Friendly service. Ordered two bagel sandos, iced coffee, and smoothie. Coffee came out first - it was awful. I don't even know how to describe it, like old coffee mixed with a hint of chocolate? It almost didn't taste like coffee. I threw it away after a few sips. Smoothie came next, and it was super duper sweet. It was supposed to be a banana strawberry mango smoothie, and it tasted fake and full of sugar. We asked the woman behind the counter and she said it was because they put syrup on it. She was super nice and asked us if we wanted it to be remade - we hesitated then said yes, but asked for it without syrup. Then the woman explained that the syrup they use is the syrup of the fruit basically strawberry syrup and mango syrup - to substitute using real fruit- so she wouldn't be able to make it any less sweet. We learned that the strawberry and mango were the fruits they used sweetener for, and the banana was not, so we agreed to a new shake. She remade us a spinach avo banana smoothie - but with the banana sweetener taste. (?!?!) not sure what the miscommunication was there, but the new smoothie still wasn't great.

The breakfast sandos were good, a tad salty but expected with cheddar and ham. Bagels are good 

Was hoping to support a local business but would have liked much better coffee and some transparency with the food they serve.
author: A Y.

description:
Very yummy ginger chai latte! Really nice strength of the ginger flavor and spice!

Also very fresh and delicious bagel tomato egg and avocado.
author: Tommy S.

description: Great little place! Coffee and bagels are warm, delicious and reasonably priced. The owner and employees are very friendly. Would recommend!
author: Biqing Q.

description: I came here with a friend to find a spot to study. It was a cute place and the lady working the register was very kind. My friend got a smoothie and she loved it. Note that if you want to study here, there are no outlets, but they do have wifi. I would come here again to study due to the quiet atmosphere.
author: Lynn T.

description: Absolutely AMAZING. Get the B.L.T with avocado. You will not regret it. The ladies service was wonderful. She was all smiles and asked how our meal was.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Amazing ginger chai. Seriously best I've ever had. This is a super cute place. Cozy, warm, and good for reading. Free wifi but no outlets or bathroom so probably not the best go-to spot for laptop work (which is why I give it 4 rather than 5 stars). 

The owner here is so sweet! I'd much rather support a place like this than a chain store. Already planning what I'm going to get when I come back for round two!
author: Ariel M.

description: Came here in Christmas and it was open! Super happy about that and also the fact that the breakfast croissants are to die for! I got bacon egg cheddar and avocado on a croissant...delicious!
author: Megan P.

description: Omggggg this place is so good! I got the tofu sandwich. She makes the tofu herself. Vegan galore. It's also a short walk from the N muni stop, cole + Stanyan. Also you HAVE to get the spinach avocado and banana smoothie. My boyfriend and I were fighting over it. The price is also great too!
author: Jenny M.

description:
even tho lava java is right on stanyan street the sweet cheery staff and the great coffee and delicious treats, not to mention the super laid back attitude of everyone who grabs their joe there is such a refreshing change from the hustle and bustle and millions of phones found in nearly every other coffee shop in town.
no wifi. no cards, just cash, outside tables to leisurely sip your cuppa and chat the morning away around.
it's a great escape in the upper haight and cole valley!
another reason i enjoy going there is it's a great place to take the pup when we're on our way for a walk in the park.  he has lots of room to hang out in front with us and he really enjoys it there as well!
author: Rochelle F.

description: I've been in town since June, and nearly stopped in one time...but today I ignored my gut feeling. Bangkok 900 was closed, and I was really fiending for a good, hot Tom Kha Gai soup...I should have just skipped this place, and gone down to Kezar Pub for shepherd's pie, but I saw chicken noodle soup on the menu. When I asked if they still had any chicken noodle and got a blank stare I should have taken that as a hint that it's obviously from a can of the Campbell's variety, microwaved with a couple of fresh spinach leaves and ground peper thrown on top. Was that to fool me? I don't know. But ugh. My sandwich was just okay - a veggie avocado swiss MISSING THE SWISS cheese - but I could have cut a can of soup and made a sandwich at home, and saved myself thirteen bucks.
author: Alexandra R.

description: Lava Java is my favorite breakfast place in San Francisco. The owner is friendly and welcomes you every morning. The food is fresh and definitely a great way to start the day. The assortment of coffee is what intrigued me though. Hawaiian Blend is great!
author: Eric M.

description: Love this little coffee shack...mini outdoor lounge space, reasonable prices, love their peppermint and almond iced coffee
author: Sandra S.

description:
I don't like how everything is made with a microwave. If I wanted microwaved food, I would make a TV dinner at home. 

No wifi and cash only.
author: Eddie L.

description: This is one of my favorite places to get a sandwich! I love the avocado Swiss vegi sandwich!! Always friendly staff and quick service.
author: Ismail M.

description:
Wanted to get an early breakfast after being jet lagged from my east coast flight and I came in at 645.. but the website time was wrong (opens at 7 not 630 it seems) the cashier was the only person working and super sweet and nice; got a iced vanilla chai and egg cheddar mushroom on sesame bagel.. Which was really good (although the chai a tad sweet for my taste). Pretty efficient service.

Only downside aside from the opening time error was some flies buzzing around me during my breakfast. Headed there cause of its early opening time but might skip out next time.
author: Tammy J.

description: Pretty good coffee options. Small and cozy interior. This place has the best sun dried tomato cream cheese. It's house made on the daily. Goes well on any bagel. Good place for a quick pit stop.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Excellent customer service! The man appeared to be young and new to the job the woman helping was so kind and patient. My sandwich was delightful and so was my ginger chai! Over all good experience. For a quick service meal I give it 5 stars.
author: Karen K.

description: Perfect cream cheese bacon bagel and love their iced coffee. Everyone who works there is super sweet too! My go-to!
author: Ellen S.

description: Great spot for cup of joe before heading to Golden Gate Park. They only take cash but the lady was super nice. The dark roast called Lava Java was delicious and robust.
author: Beth M.

description:
I live 3 blocks from this place but rarely go. Today I was dropping off a bike for a quick repair at American Cyclery Too, so went in for a cuppa while I was waiting. I have no complaints with this place, and as I was waiting for my coffee, a patron left, calling, "Thanks Annie!" to the proprietor.  So I thought to myself, gee, why DON'T I come here? It's my neighborhood coffee shop. Sure, I have other options (Peets, Reverie, the place on the corner of Waller and Cole, all of Haight Street, etc) but golly what a nice, neighborhood feel...my girls would love it...

With this warm fuzzy feeling floating around my psyche, I ordered my red eye. My $2.50 red eye. Cool. Yet when I asked for some water, I was told that I had to purchase it. "For to-go you have to pay for water, tap water is only to eat here." 

Now I get that this place is very close to GG Park and bike rentals and the Haight and UCSF and I am sure that A LOT of tourists stop in to this place. HOWEVER, I really take issue with this response - so much so that I am inspired to Yelp about it. First off, no one asked me if my coffee was "for here" or "to go," and as a matter of fact, I was planning to sit down and drink it while waiting for my bike (which I did). So theoretically it was "for here." Second of all I did just pay $2.50 for a cup of coffee; would a cup of water for a paying customer really be too much to ask for?

Disappointing.
author: Judith S.

description:
-Opens at 6:30am
-Cash only.
-Veg/Vegan friendly (Avocado Swiss and Tofu LT are awesome). 

This was the first place we went to after a long flight into SFO. Right down the street from our hotel (Stanyan Park). Ended up being lunch and dinner in one meal as it was so filling. Best sandwiches we had while in SFO. We definitely came back for more! 

What makes this place great is their customer service. We were a bit short on cash for our breakfast order and the server suggested bringing it to our next visit. 

You can tell this is a favourite neighbourhood spot and with good reason! 

Ontario, Canada.
author: Yvette D.

description: Friendly welcome. Quaint hole in wall. Many options. Got the sandwich for breakfast on a crossaint. And a chai. Check it out. Def a neighborhood cafe
author: Bradley K.

description:
HMmm messed up my Vanilla Chai Latte and you made me walk across the street to the ATM... ::ANNOYED::

Get a Square ATM Card reader...!! this is 2013...
author: Andrew V.

description: Stopped in here on my way back from a run. When I arrived there was only one person in front of me in line who appeared to have just finished ordering...There were 3 people behind the counter, all of which were huddled around the sandwich making / prep area struggling with what seemed to be a hummus dilemma (I think it was misplaced.) It was 5+ mins before I ordered my matcha latte which I firmly believe was condensed milk mixed with a combo of peppermint/coffee grinds (it was brown, matcha is typically green, and it didn't taste a hint like green tea). All-in-all poor communication on the staffs behalf, and 4$ for something I didn't even drink.
author: Chris D.

description:
I popped in to lava java on my way to the AIDS walk because I started chatting up some other people on the muni.  They recommended the place, were good company, and I decided to chat a bit more and stop for coffee with them.

A number of other people had the same idea, there was a bit of a line when we walked in.  The line is both good and bad, good in this instance because I figured Lava Java must be OK and I could read the menu.  

In the end I got a cappuccino, my standard coffee drink.  The coffee was on the dark side for my taste, I would get a latte next time I'm here instead of a cappuccino.  However, SF coffee and West Coast in general is on the darker side.

My companions got a variety of beverages from hot cocoa to smoothies for the kids.  Everyone was very happy with their drink and the service was fairly quick despite the line.   Lava Java looks like a good solid neighborhood coffee and sandwich shop with a good selection of non coffee drinks too.
author: Lisa R.

description: Went there for the chai, but they don't make it plain without milk or sugar (I'm keto). Got a different tea with peaches in it, pretty good. They played classical music that was kind of loud and kept breaking up, a bit annoying. The door also doesn't swing shut so it stayed open a lot. It was cold and rainy the day I went so I had to get up a few times to close it. Cozy atmosphere, fast & free wifi. They didn't have a bathroom and only took cash which was a bummer, would have stayed longer if they had a restroom.
author: Anon Y.

description:
How is this place still open for business??????????

Okay, so I give every coffe shop/ cafe a chance... but this place. AWFUL!!!!!!!!

Let me start with this: I am not some tourist coming here and expecting this to be cafe paris, I live in the neighborhood and I am all about supporting our local coffee shops and cafe's.

HOWEVER, this place probably had the worst tasting chai latte I have ever experienced.

I brought my friend who was visiting from LA here for a quick morning bite and coffee....we read on YELP that it was legit so hey, okay! off we go!

The lady who runs it was extremely rude. My friend just wanted a Bagel with eggs and meat on it...
 the lady said, "NO! Its not a menu item". Okay? Well its basically a bagel sandwich (on the menu) with no cheese... why cant we do that?

my friend: "Okay, well is it pre made or something? I just want a bagel with egg and meat on it..."

lady at the register: "no, not pre made. That  just too hard for them to understand. Has to be menu item!"

It was weird....

Okay, So we just order our "menu items" and I get a gingerbread chai latte and my friend just wants a water....we go and sit.... waiting... waiting...

okay here is the food....

We finish our cardboard tasting  bagel sandwiches.... and no coffee or water?

I go in...

me: "Hi, we didnt get our water or my coffee..."

woman behind the register: "oh!"
looks at the other lady and says, "did you make latte?"

Of course she didnt.... 

so I waited for the latte and then she goes over to the sink fills up a nasty ass (home dish) turquoise plastic cup with tap water and hands it to me for my friend.... wtf??? thats gross. 
and the water had oil film in it. NASTY!!!!!!

Okay.... then my latte comes 10 minutes later and it BLOWS!!!! like BLOWS!!!!

Do not go here. Awful service, rude, and nasty food and drink.

YUCK!!!!!!!!
author: Angela I.

description: ginger chai is so strong and tasty. A little on the sweet side but I still enjoyed it. My dad requested we go back because they were so inviting and warm. You really feel welcome and like you're part of the family. Thanks for making our visit that much better.
author: Natasha P.

description: Friendly staff, cute and quaint store, banana bread is awesome and the coconut mocha is a must!
author: S N.

description:
Decent coffee and friendly service. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but a good stop in the neighborhood for sure. 

I had a soy latte which was average. I wouldn't want to sit here any time; the coffee shops seems rather sparse and not-welcoming. I've never tried their food.
author: Sneha P.

description: Whether you are craving a caffeine fix, fruit smoothie or a Thai ice tea, Lava Java got you covered. The drinks are good, and there is indoor and outdoor seating. They play classical music, which I enjoyed. I stopped by for a minute and stayed for half an hour. Cute cozy place, it's definitely a neighborhood gem. I will be back when I am in Cole Valley!
author: Irena P.

description: I visited here twice while staying in the area.   I did not encounter any rude people and the service was decent.   The person I was with had very good food and he wanted to go back the next day.   I had a white mocca, which was really good.   I saw people dining in and they seemed content.    A man brought in his baby even, and that seemed to go okay.   I wasn't aware it was cash only, as I planned to pay with cash and did; HOWEVER, I frequently do pay with a card, so that would be a minus if I was cashless.   I wouldn't hit an ATM for sure.  I gave them a 4, because it was pretty good overall in my experience.
author: David P.

description: Been here a few times for coffee and pastries. The service was great, the coffee was delicious and their pastries are very tasty. I'm always very impressed by the very cheerful, attentive and polite service here and will be back the next time I'm nearby and in need of some caffeine.
author: Drew H.

description:
Coffee is tasty.  Sandwiches, off the hook.  Really chill vibe.

Not the most comfortable place to work on one's laptop (seats a bit uncomfortable, and no power outlets in sight), but this corner has just the right amount of ambient noise for a productive 1.5 hr work session.
author: Mihai P.

description:
Excellent selection of chai tea latte, this cozy coffee shop did not disappoint!

They had regular vanilla chai, ginger chai, green tea chai, and chocolate chai...and honestly, I've never seen or known that so many chai latte options existed! 

I tried the ginger chai, and wow was it an explosion of ginger flavor! The good thing about it was, you can taste the real ginger juices and pulp almost, and the freshness of this little cup of latte instead of paying for fake food flavoring. I asked for it to be extra hot and the temperature was definitely a lot more desirable than the extra hot at Starbucks.

The service was exceptional, and the selection of regular coffee was also vast, with 4-5 choices hot and ready for you to try at the counter, along with all the creamer and sugar options.

Although seating is a little limited, if you aren't here during busy hours, it makes a great place to relax and hang out.

Their sandwiches also looked delicious, will definitely come back!
author: Luby H.

description: I had never been here prior to a couple days ago and now I can't picture going anywhere else for a late brunch! I had the Irish Cream Ice Coffee and the wrap with egg & avocado. Although I HIGHLY recommend the Irish coffee, I would NOT recommend the wrap which was delicious but sadly was too moist and it soaked through the wax paper, napkins, and on my pants. The view here is great and the atmosphere is peaceful (it's between the busy Haight st and the suburbs).
author: Emily M.

description: The spinach mushroom breakfast sandwich on a croissant is amazing! The vanilla chai is delicious as well, not too spicy and not too sweet :)
author: Nina C.

description: The owner was so incredibly kind and friendly! I just got a sesame bagel with jalapeño cream cheese and cucumber. It was beyond delicious. The cream cheese is made in house. It was honestly the most tasty bagel I've ever had. There were slices of cucumber and some other delicious sauce. You can tell they take pride in their store!
author: Beth E.

description: Love this place. I often stop in (when I remember to bring cash!) to get a half vanilla / half ginger chai. Good blend of sweet and spicy. Cute and unpretentious, with friendly staff. Often filled with locals, not as many of the Haight Street tourist crowd. If they took credit cards, I'd probably be here even more often!
author: Meera C.

description:
I've been spending a lot of time in Cole Valley/Haught street neighbourhood lately. So I check out this neighborhood cafe which located on Stanyan.

OhMy... The owner - an Asian lady, is very rude. I mean okay, I understand that there could be cultural differences... but hey shouldn't the person who's probably been in this country for a while and been a business owner, have better manners and know how to to deal with patrons, people in general??

It was very unpleasant experience. If you want a different "exotic" type of service - go ahead and try. I'm not gonna be coming back. There are plenty coffee shops and cafes around.
author: Rom M.

description:
If you are a lover of all things delicious, get yourself the vanilla chai latte. 
Do yourself a favor and DO NOT get any of the iced chai drinks, the powder NEVER dissolves into the drink. 
** Only accepts cash **
author: Lissette V.

description:
Pretty darn yummy bagel breakfast sandwiches. Me and my bf used to get one every weekend until we decided that we need to tone down the carbs in our lives :/

I also used to get a chocolate banana muffin like every other day as well (it's a problem when they start grabbing the muffin for you before you order it  -_-)

So now I just stick to ordering from their pretty good selection of brewed coffee. Never disappoints.

Aside from the yummy food and drinks, they have really awesome service and they're a great little spot to do some reading/work in.
author: Brisa D.

description: Best place to get breakfast sandwiches. Bagels are so fresh and so delicious. I tried their coconut mocha today for the first time, super tasty. Not to mention how sweet and lovely they all are always
author: Jessica J.

description: The NICEST lady runs this place. Close to the park, and Haight, but far enough from both that none of the bad/annoying people come here. Needed a coffee on Christmas, and Lava Java was open! Three cheers!
author: B L.

description: Everyday before work, this place warms me up with kindness and the sweet taste of their lattes. I always get a smile from them.
author: Kaida C.

description:
Meh.

(+) Friendly staff, good espresso

(-) Plastic-wrapped stale old pastries, cash only, cramped inside, impossibly slow internet, difficult to understand cashier
author: Benjamin K.

description: Such a nice little cafe! Fast wifi, excellent chai tea and the owner is very friendly.
author: Mike G.

description: good little place for coffee   limited seating    outside the best    Peets coffee    it's good
author: Robert E.

description:
The coffee is always good and the staff is always friendly. 

Wifi is available, but bring your laptop juiced because there is nowhere to plug in.
author: Daniel K.

description: Great place to get a nice lunch sandwich and the staff are very very helpful when it comes to your needs. Chai tea is amazballs the ham/swiss sandwich is to die for. Wish it was open more and not cash only but hey I cant complain its well worth the awesomeness!
author: Jeremiah W.

description:
oh lava java..... where do I begin.

there are meat options, bread options, cheese options yet - I cannot mix and match?! NOT because it is premade food BUT because it is "TOO complicated for your 'cooks'" 

Ok fiiiiiiiine I will take a non premade sandwich as is, and a water.

I pick at my gross microwaved sandwich and wait and wait and wait for my water.

My friend has to go in and ask for our drinks - and she hands me a DISGUSTING crusty looking green plastic cup from someone's home or to water plants. WHAT THE...... I go in and ask for a water in a plastic cup to go because well I finished my food 15 min ago and she refused to give me a water to go. I could not believe the owner expected me or anyone for that matter to drink out of a plastic crusty cup. So UNSANITARY. 

Worse SF cafe experience ever. If I could negative star rate them - I would!
author: Ashley D.

description:
I pass Lava Java often, but never really find myself with the time to stop in.  So on a lazy weekend afternoon, I finally made it happen.

It's a really cute little place, with both indoor and outdoor seating, and the afternoon sun coming through its front window made the whole place downright cozy.  Also helping this were the cases upon cases of yummy pastries and the smiles I received from behind the counter.  

I ordered an iced ginger chai latte from a small handful of available chais, noting through the very variety that I had found the right place.  Ginger chai?  Who does that?  Not Starbucks, that's for sure.  I was further tickled when I was asked if I wanted my ice crushed or cubed, and then kindly directed to the nearest ATM when I realized the place was cash only.

Upon my return, my drink was ready and I was assured by the awesome barista that I had chosen the best one.  There wasn't really a doubt in my mind, but it was good to have her confirm my suspicions.  I thanked her, and went out to the front of the building, sipping my drink at an outdoor table and soaking in the surprisingly-decent weather.  I had chosen crushed ice, by the way, so it was a veritable chai and ginger smoothie.  If there's a part of your body that doesn't say "Yes" to that, you might want to have it checked by a doctor.

While Lava Java is still not in an area that's incredibly convenient to me, I must say that I'm actually going to make a point to go there more often.  It's not that far out of the way, and they're good people who can  make a mean drink.  They also unquestionably made my afternoon.
author: Becca S.

description: Nicest folks around. Proper Japanese green sencha served in lovely little teapots. Their chai is splendiferous, and you can mix 'n' match flavors (ginger + vanilla= yumm). Stay for a homemade tofu sandwich.
author: Rachel D.

description: Whoops. They stopped making my veggie burger. Tried the Tofu but not the same. The Turkey-Bacon is now my go-to.
author: Stan P.

description:
I went back this morning and tried their Hawaiian Macadamia Nut Chocolate coffee... it tasted AMAZING.

Morning rush was there again... but hey! There were two people working at the counter this time! :D
author: J T.

description:
I live right around the corner from this place and must've walked by a thousand times without ever stopping in -- even though I know my roomie is addicted to their green tea chai latte. Well, on Friday I finally stopped in for my first time, and the GINGER CHAI LATTE CHANGED MY LIFE. Seriously, it's a drink that you need to experience. Delish.

In fact, I loved it so much that I went back later that very same afternoon. Except for my second time around I decided to try the pumpkin chai latte. The barista was super friendly, sweet, and helpful as I tried to decide what to order, and as he was making my drink I kept chatting away -- I think my rambling might've distracted him because he ended up making a pumpkin spice latte instead of the pumpkin chai. Now normally I'd have just taken the pumpkin spice and rolled with it, but he was so sweet that he insisted on making the pumpkin chai and gave me both!

They were both delicious, although 3 lattes was (ha!) a latte (haha) for one day (gosh I crack myself up).

I even went back both Saturday and Sunday this weekend and got the pumpkin spice latte because it was so good. SO GOOD.

You need to check this place out. The service and drinks are fantastic. Totally beats anywhere else in the neighborhood.
author: Theresa P.

description: This place would have gotten 5 stars if it were just based on taste alone. The bagel sandwich and Hawaiian Chocolate Macadamia nut coffee were awesome. But, the guy insisted on taking my order over a very loud milk steamer, and of course got it wrong because he couldn't hear me. The coffee was lukewarm and the door propped open left no escape from a chilly morning. Cash only.
author: Billy M.

description:
Cute shop with a great location; right across the street from Kezar.  They confirmed that they do have free wifi, but they do not have any outlets.  Turns out there are no outlets in the front area because the shop was converted from a house.  It leaves me wondering...where did they plug in their lamps?  

For a working professional looking for a place to set up shop for a couple hours with their computer, this will not do.  If your electronics are already all charged up, you are planning read something on paper, or just planning to have a chat, it seems like a comfortable place to be.  

Didn't order anything substantial, but their ice tea was mediocre.
author: Sonia K.

description:
I choose to come to Lava Java every morning for daily my coffee and I get a dose of Cole Valley friendliness.

I come back here because the staff is super friendly and will remember your name and what you like.  They'll make special treats for you if you're nice back.  That's why I come back, despite the fact the coffee is not the best in the city, and neither are the pastries.   The sandwiches are quite good though. 

I'd recommend the Pumpkin Latte, Chai Latte and the sandwiches.
author: Shawn M.

description: I like this place, great little coffee shop to grab breakfast in before going to work! Great prices too, but I wouldn't recommend staying because it's tiny!
author: Vincent S.

description: That Turkey and Bacon Club is flying under the radar as one of my favorite sandwiches. A laundry day go-to.
author: Jules P.

description: Lots of good caffeinated beverages. Next time I'll try the ginger or chocolate chai. Friendly baristas and low prices. Cash only.  Iced americano was fab - the owner said it's Peerless. They have eight different roasts in the mornings, light to dark. Wish I lived closer!
author: Mark P.

description:
it's right at the google shuttle bus stop. you'll be a bunch of googlers waiting for their fancy shuttles, which shuttle them down to mountain view. so they are in a good spot.

i had a coffee, a smoothie, and a bagel here on separate occasions. the coffee was good, but the smoothie and the bagel were pretty bad. i didn't finish them. the smoothie was way too sweet, and the bagel wasn't properly toasted and the texture was mealy. 
the lady who i assumed owns and runs this coffee shop was very nice. she seemed surprised i ordered a decaf at nine in the morning.
author: Te R.

description:
To be upfront, I may have come here a bunch of times, but I've only got two items. It's the banana soy shake and tofu sandwich (fyi-the special sauce is not vegan so I order without it). 

The tofu has got a lot of flavor (which can be hard to come by when talking tofu!). The banana soy shake has the right amount of thickness and not overly sweet.

The service is great: very friendly, and they always seem to remember you once you've been there just a handful of times. It really feels like a local coffeeshop without the snobbery you would most likely find in the Mission.

The caveat is you have to bring cash. Credit cards not accepted. I often walk in and then have to immediately turn around to go get cash at a nearby ATM to pay for my $11 meal.
author: Shannon D.

description:
Lava Java is my jam. It has become an obvious addiction the past several months. You'd think living on Haight Street would give me endless options for coffee and bagels, but somehow I always find myself walking toward Frederick and Stanyan to this little gem.

Hands down best bagels in the area, if not the whole city!! The coffee is always on point, always. And if somehow you manage to get the last of the pot, it is changed out instantly with a fresh one. Thats no joke when I say instantly.

I can't forget to mention the awesome customer service every time I go. The older woman with the cute glasses is an absolute sweetheart. Friendly, fast, and efficient service. 

Lava Java, I'm here to stay :)
author: Nathan H.

description: So good!  The breakfast sandwich is a must.  Coffee (latte) was perfect (right temp, flavor) for me visiting a new local spot.  The gals here were very friendly and helpful. CASH ONLY.
author: Danny E.

description:
I went in here the other day because I happened to be in the neighborhood, so I am not a regular.  But the proprietor of this shop is an incredibly nice person and the food is very good!  I just went in for a plain bagel and while I was enjoying it she brought out a sample of the strawberry banana smoothie.  IT WAS AMAZING so I had to buy one.  

Then she brought out a sample of her jalapeno cream cheese which is homemade.  Also delicious! If I wasn't trying to watch my diet at the moment I totally would have bought that too.   When my boyfriend came to pick me up I made him buy the mango banana smoothie which he also enjoyed.   

But I just wanted to write a review because like I said the proprietor was so incredibly nice, and the food was so good!  Please stop in!
author: heather c.

description:
It is a cute little coffee shop with reasonable prices for bagels, egg sandwiches, wraps, soups, and sandwiches, teas, coffees, and smoothies! I just bought a small coffee and an egg and cheddar sandwich and the grand total was about $7. Let me tell you what. They don't scrimp on the sandwiches! I had about half and was feeling full! I at the whole thing though; I'm not about to waste a perfectly good egg.

The space is small, so you wouldn't want to come here with maybe three or more people. There are 6 little round tables with about two chairs at each. The atmosphere is friendly. It is decorated in a darling way. There are plants and really funky lights that create a feeling like you're just hanging out in a small town's coffee house. I really like that.

I happened to wander in here when I was waiting for a cycle shop to open, and boy am I glad I did! The baristas were super friendly and gave service with a smile. 

Come see what you're missing!
author: Angie P.

description: Bacon scrambagel. Get it and then eat it.  Golden.  I also love the Ginger Chai.  Brittney is the best!
author: Benjamin R.

description: The staff here is AMAZING! Vanilla Chai is heavenly if you know real chai... And the granola cookie cake things are surprisingly delicious... YUMMY. Wish I lived closer, this would be my spot daily
author: Courtney B.

description: Some of the best soy Chai tea I've had! The spice level is PERFECT, it actually has a kick! In a city swarming with cafes (I love that) Lava Java sticks out as a gem in the sleepy Haight/Cole Valley interchange! Grab a cup on your way into Golden Gate park and enjoy a perk with your walk!
author: Cameron B.

description:
Chocolate Chai!!  omg - amazing, decadent, spicy, divine and soooo lovely.  Also, the breakfast bagel sandwiches are killer.  Super friendly people working there too!

Minus one star for being cash only, although I respect them keeping it real...
author: Mac M.

description:
I recently moved into the Cole Valley neighborhood a few months ago. I've been on a quest since then to check out the different spots within my neighborhood. 

Last night I was reading reviews about Lava Java, and I saw a few people had mentioned that their sandwiches were really good. So today I made it my mission to check this place out. 

I chose to get the turkey garlic pesto sandwich on a croissant. After I ordered it the guy behind the counter asked if I wanted lettuce, red onions, and a few other options to put on it. I opted for just lettuce, and asked for it to go. It took a few minutes to get it, but when I unwrapped it at home I realized it was worth the wait!

Great sandwich! And I'll definitely be back to try other items as well.
author: Sara K.

description:
great local spot. friendly. good food. good prices. 
(free wifi, cash ONLY)
author: Colleen R.

description:
Green tea latte and mango smoothies are great. Get one before taking a stroll at the golden gate park or do your window shopping at haight st.

Will be an okay cafe if it's not for the chocolate chai. Yuck... I can't even stand the smell of it. How can you get wrong with chocolate or chai? And by all mean, I am not picky at all. This is probably a super rare occassion where I throw away drink because I think it's yucky. My friends also cannot take more than 1 sip of this drink.

No bathroom too so that may take away .5 star. It's tempting to give it one star but... I think it won't hurt to actually give another star considering that some people may actually like the chocolate chai
author: Cliff T.

description: Still continue to go here for coffee and breakfast on the weekends. The owner and workers are really great. Go for the egg, cheese, whatever on a croissant OR the garlic pesto turkey sandwich on croissant.
author: Michael M.

description: Great little cafe near kezar/haight street. The lady who owns and runs this restaurant is very friendly and sweet. Delicious breakfast wraps and good selection of coffees and teas. Highly recommend!
author: Annie G.

description:
(3.5 stars)
I was walking back from the DMV on Fell and wishing that there was a Phliz nearby when I walked by Lava Java. I had gotten Hawaiian Macademia Nut Coffee here before ( I LOVE coffee with natural flavor) and so I decided to get it again. They have a ton of other little snacks and the sandwiches look really good. 

I poured the coffee and realized they were cash only reason that I would give them 3.5 stars instead of 4 (really annoying) but thankfully I just scraped together enough for the cup of coffee. 

One a side note.. the cashier, I think she owns the place too, had really awesome clear, large glasses so I complimented her and she laughed and told me they were too old fashioned and she had them forever. She said that she would find out for me what the brand was, which was sweet. Overall, good experience.
author: Sirina K.

description: Absolutely killer turkey sandwich! Took off 1 star because it is a cash only place. But the barista is amazing and friendly. There's two tables outside if you want to have some outside eating. I like to bring my puppy with me when I go and we just relax outside with a mocha! Great location as well - not far from the golden gate park so it's nice to take your drink or sandwich and go eat in the park!
author: Zack J.

description:
Hands down the best breakfast bagel sandwiches I've had so far in the city!  I've had the ham, egg and cheese more than once and it is pure deliciousness.  Egg is perfectly cooked and seasoned with oregano and black pepper. Ham is a delight. Bagel very fresh soft. 

A perfect place to stop after your morning workout!

PLUS the owner is lovely. So friendly. I'm going to keep coming back again and again.
author: Troy C.

description:
The Turkey Sandwich with garlic pesto on croissant was so good, I've been craving it all week...
Going to get one today.
author: Karlee D.

description: As soon as you walk into Lava Java, there is a framed picture of Lava Java on the wall.  There is also glorious pictures of all the food and drinks you are about to order.  Owner Ann always greets you with a sharp hello and a smile.  The sandwiches and the drinks are great, especially the chai which is unique and spicy.  Remember to order cheddar with your bagel, and not cheese.  We think the sandwich guy got fired once for saying so.
author: Alex P.

description:
I recently decided to move to Cole Valley to a place without a garbage disposal or solid walls, mainly so I would be closer to Lava Java. 

They always remember how I like my breakfast bagel sandwiches, and don't take it personally that I request extra salt.  Also, my boyfriend and I frequently see the owner (well, we think she is the owner) out in the neighborhood and she always remembers us. Sure, we go there a few times a week, but we aren't especially memorable, so this is a big deal.

Plus, you know. Good coffee and stuff.
author: Leata H.

description:
Best Chai Latte, hands down.

All the other places (that I've been to, anyway) make chai lattes using pre-mix chai, usually from some kind of large plastic jug. They go anywhere from awful to downright depressing. 

Not Lava Java. They make their own, and you can taste a huge difference! It's delicious, fresh, hot and oh-so-creamy. Dreamy. And, while you're waiting for yours to be freshly brewed, you can munch down on one of the little round chocolate brownies at the counter. (The white-ish ones are ok, but nothing like the dark brown brownie-roundies :-) Careful: Could become habit forming...
author: Clint K.

description:
I agree with other readers on 2-scores: a) the restroom issue (I actually thought it was the law if you have any sit-down tables)? b) the credit card issue (although, having had my own business most of my life, I know the % rate of each sale and now most banks also charge at least a 50-cent transaction fee can really eat into profits..the result is higher pricing).
Karen (I believe she is the owner) greets everyone who comes through the door like they were her best friend (she called 76% of the folks by name when I was there yesterday for my first eat-in experience). I had a turkey/bacon club which for $6.40 total tax-included was great. I presently live in the neighborhood and often take coffee out...the latte is lovely.
author: Lee S.

description: The ginger chai latte is so spicy and delicious. The woman behind the counter  was helpful and friendly.
author: Gretchen H.

description: Ginger chai here is awesome.  Cash only though - fyi.  The owner  is very nice and almost always in there.  They can take some time making drinks, so don't try to get anything fancy if you have to catch a bus in one minute.  I haven't had any food except baked goods, which are decent enough.
author: Liz N.

description: Good coffee, great sandwiches, friendly staff. So far I have had the Ginger Chai (at the recommendation of fellow yelpers) and the hazelnut latte. Both delicious. Free WiFi is a plus. Don't forget..its cash only!
author: Danielle P.

description:
I liked this place before I even stopped in just because it has a low-key vibe and is definitely a neighborhood place. It is a little smaller inside than I thought, cozy perhaps. 

The prices seem very reasonable-- a medium cup of tea is 1.70 for example. I didn't realize when I was there that they have free wireless, but that seems like a large added bonus. 

I found the baristas helpful, but not as friendly as Yelper Lee-John S. It was definitely busy for such a small space. The only problem with that is that I can't see being able to get much work done here. Despite the free wireless, it doesn't seem like Lava Java is really geared toward the working crowd. I think that's cool because not all coffee shops need to be copies of one another. Given the great prices on sandwiches, I would say this is a good place to drop by for lunch and maybe get to know some people in the neighborhood.
author: Katy W.

description:
When I first moved to Cole Valley we stopped in here and the people working that day were so nice to us we've kept going.  I particularly enjoy the European Royale.  They have a couple tables setup outside but if you sit there don't expect a tranquil chat with your paramour as the cars and busses on Stanyan stand a good chance of drowning out your palabras de amor.  If it's peace and quiet comtemplation that you want it's better to head into the park.

I annointed LJ my patron saint of caffeine when joining the impossible-to-get-to-the-bar early morning crowds at Kezar Pub during the World Cup.  I grabbed some joe to go and then tucked inside the door at Kezar to get my soccer fix.
author: Steve B.

description: good, solid coffee & a bagel spot. very friendly, neighbhorhood vibe despite proximity to the park / the haight.
author: Mary E.

description:
Homemade chai, NOT FROM A MIX!

Healthy, delish oatcakes

So friendly!

Lo Carb Big Train Ice Blended drinks.
author: Megan G.

description:
Unpretentious coffee shop.  The fourth star is for their crazy delicious egg cheddar mushroom bagel that is the only thing I now crave when hungover.  

It also doesn't hurt that it's within crawling distance.
author: James M.

description: One of the best blended iced mochas that I've ever had!  Was absolutely amazing.  Also very friendly service and reasonable prices.  I look forward to going back =)
author: Swetha G.

description: Cute laid back place with an AMAZING turkey pesto garlic sandwich. I usually grab breakfast here, so I was not expecting their lunch menu to be worth while, but it is. For breakfast their "everything" bagel with cream cheese is my fav. Coffee is self serve and they have a pretty nice selection. Very good chai lattes. My only complaint, which is not even worth losing a star, would be the blueberry muffin. Bland and dry. Stay away from the BB muffin, but go for just about ANYTHING else. :)
author: Lisa F.

description:
Annie - the lady who runs  this little cafe is so sweet and friendly.  i love that in a walk-up-and-order-at-the-counter kind of place.

but let's talk about the egg/bacon/cheese sandwich on a baguette (you have to order it with the baguette- i don't think it appears on the menu).  it's to die for.  i've tried to duplicate it at home (i live next door) to save the $4.50, but i just can't manage it for some reason.  the eggs are so much fluffier than mine - and the spices are perfect.  

and then there's the bacon club sandwich on a toasted baguette.  i can't even walk by here without salivating at the smell.  so de-lish and so not a part of my current diet (damn).

the coffee is ok - nothing special - but it's these sandwiches and the friendly service that make it a 5-star for moi.
author: Kate F.

description: I may have become a little addicted to the bacon, egg and cheese on whole wheat bagel sandwich here. Their coffee is the best in the neighborhood, and the staff is beyond nice. The only downside to Lava Java is that they seem to be the epicenter of an AT&T dead zone, so don't plan on browsing your iPhone while you wait for your order.
author: Mark A.

description:
Lava Java is good at what it does, and isn't that the ultimate definition of success? This place is not fancy or pretentious, there are no frilly names for things and no hurried Starbucks vibe, but they make great lattes, killer breakfast bagels, and have a good and plentiful selection of coffee in the morning (and they let you taste to figure out which one you want). I am not a fan of flavored coffees really, I tend to enjoy more "serious" coffee (as in good quality black coffee), but there are many flavors for those who like something sweeter. 

The people who run this place are SOO nice... my boyfriend goes in there nearly every day (more than once sometimes) and he always returns with a little sample of some pastry or some drink that they give him free of charge. This feels like a neighborhood coffee house because they know you, however not many people stick around to enjoy their purchases. 

Lava Java is WAYY better than something like Tully's any day, and even though Reverie brags about its "French Laundry Coffee," that stuff tastes really bitter (I have a feeling Thomas Keller does a better job making his, even if they are the same beans). Lava Java is definitely the way to go!
author: Amanda C.

description: This place is a find -- best sandwiches ever. It must be a combination of the cucumber slices in the sandwiches and the toasted bread that is so, so good.
author: Angie C.

description:
Cute place with friendly, fast service. The marinated tofu/lettuce/tomato/hummus sandwich was amazing--my mouth is still watering hours later. 

I can't quite give 5 stars, though. For one, there's no bathroom. The lady at the counter nicely told me to try the McDonald's down the street. she was nice about it, but really--if you sell both food and drink and have inviting little tables to sit at, then you need to do better than that, bathroom-wise.

Also, some of the smaller nibbles were overpriced. Do people really pay $1 for one of those tiny Aussie bites that comes out of a CostCo can?
author: Ramon E.

description:
Lava Java is one of my favorite places in the area.  They're small but have seating on the nice wide Stanyan sidewalk.  Their sandwiches and breakfast bagels are amazing - the tofu sandwich is my favorite, it's packed full of flavor.  Their chai tea latte and pot of special blend tea are both wonderful.  Lots of little baked goods and other nummies too.

Love the staff here as well, I always look forward to a visit on laundry day!
author: Simon B.

description: I come here often for a latte & sometimes grab a breakfast sandwich. The owner is so sweet and has lovely energy about her. She usually remembers everyone that comes in by name & definitely makes you feel welcomed. I like sitting outside with my dog while catching up on my SF weekly events. Its very cozy inside as well and reasonably priced. The free wireless is a plus too! Also good to remember its a cash only joint so don't forget to bring your change
author: Meg O.

description:
There are two types of people that go to coffee shops.  Starbucks people and everyone else!  IF you fall into the latter, you'd enjoy Lava Java.

It's a no non-sense coffee shop, where you serve yo'self regular coffee.  Yeps, that's small, medium , and large Amigo!  Next, order the freagin delicious bagel with eggs/ham.  Get the whole wheat, you need some goodness... Now, kick back , read the paper outside, chill out man.

I rarely get the cappucino, or use the google when i'm there, so I can't tell you how good that would be.  I do like the latte, it's goodness.  Also, they have the odd wall a  juices and other stuff.  

Get on with life...and don't double park infront of the bus stop!  In case you don't know, the muni buses now have cameras and you will receive an automatic ticket-----not goodness Gavin!
author: Mark K.

description: You know how food can change your mood? Well, Lava Java has more than great coffee. They have happiness disguised as sandwiches.  As a matter of fact I frequent this Cafe for the sandwiches more than the coffee. I am eating a Turkey Bacon Club right now and I had to stop to write this review. They have a small menu. So small that they don't even have a take away menu. But I recommend the egg ham cheddar on a croissant (in the morning) - Turkey Pesto on croissant (lunch) - or the Turkey Bacon Club - gotta go eat it now. Cao
author: Mark C.

description: I work across the street from Lava Java.  Like alot of people, I need caffeine in the AM to stay upright and non-zombified.  LJ isn't the only option for coffee in the neighborhood, just the best.  They also have a plethora of snacks & sweets to tempt the sweet tooth (or the fruit eating tooth, if you prefer).  They have a great staff, always friendly and welcoming. But the jewel on the crown?  Amazing sandwiches, not just for a coffee shop, but by any standards.
author: Harrison A.

description:
Quaint little coffee bar. Didn't feel rushed...kinda like a little home breakfast nook. Friendly staff.
This visit, tried their hummus and veggie sandwich since I was 'starvin' marvin' :0)
Yummy! Bread toast..good amount of cheese, veggies, and hummus. Would return.
author: Jen T.

description: The owner is incredibly sweet.  We were the only people in there and she would check-in occasionally to see if we were doing fine.  Cash only is a little bit of a pain.  Turkey garlic pesto sandwich on a croissant is simply divine.  Bagel sandwiches are good as well.  And now I am craving a sandwich.
author: Christina O.

description: They have *The Best* iced mocha (which I like "flurry" style) in San Francisco. And they also have really yummy sandwiches - and that says a lot since I am *so* NOT a sandwich person. But even I enjoyed their sandwich.
author: Melaina E.

description: The combination of it being a particularly cool and windy afternoon along with it being right where the 71 let me off made Lava Java the perfect warm-up (literally and pre-shopping my way down Haight).  Having four chais to choose from, I asked the barista to recommend his favorite and/or the most popular.  He offered up both and I went with the popular ginger chai.  Best chai I've ever had.  If you like the spiciness of crystallized ginger, this would be right up your alley.  Spicy, smooth, and not overly sweet.  And very reasonable at $2.25 for the 16 oz medium.
author: Em D.

description: A decent Iced coffee, but the best part was being able to smoke a cigarette right next to the front door without being yelled at by the PC Action Police. Refills were a dollar.
author: Sam A.

description:
If you're someone looking for the perfect breakfast bagel this is your place!
Ham, egg and cheese on a whole wheat bagel. To die for.
Loads of ham and cheese, my toes are still curling.
Excellent choice of brewed coffees! Great Spot
author: Will B.

description:
I really want to like this place - they have a friendly staff and its a cute neighborhood place.

But they burn the milk in the lattes every time.  Every time.  argh!  and the coffee is blah.

But the hummus veggie sandwich is fantastic.  highly recommended.

And its cash only, which can be annoying.
author: Kari W.

description: This place is great, it's the perfect little coffee shop. I love the vanilla and ginger chai latte and the ham and cheese breakfast bagel is amazing. Cash only though! The service is great too.
author: Alexandra D.

description: I just went here after a jog over at Kezar Stadium and really, REALLY enjoyed their Ginger Chai. I tried it blended and it was the perfect refreshing treat post workout. You really taste the fresh ginger in their homemade chai. They also make super yummy tofu sandwiches. I'll definitely be going back!
author: Ericka A.

description: Nice little coffee shop tucked away back here next to the tanning salon/nail shop. I like to stop by here when the line at Rockin' Java is too congested and I'm on my way to the Inner Sunset for some breakfast. It's not especially good, but it does the job and they have hazelnut coffee, a much beloved beverage of my high school days. They have all the usual SF coffee shop trappings including a nice sandwich menu which I only bring up because I noticed a few days ago that the veggie sandwich (usual hummus + veg) was more expensive than the meat ones. What is the deal with that??
author: Maria D.

description:
It's not fancy, but it's my go-to coffee shop when I'm at work.  I would not have survived those 7am shifts without their coffee.  The staff are very friendly and I can always count on an enthusiastic chorus of "Hi Julia!" when I walk in.

Also?  The green tea smoothie is solid gold.  I have no idea what they put in it to make it so delicious, but try it and you'll be blown away.
author: C. Julia H.

description: 6 varieties of freshly brewed coffee. You pump so that you can add as much or little cream without having to abashedly ask for a little (lot) room for cream. Amazing breakfast sandwiches and snacky breads. People are so nice that you think you're in your great aunt's kitchen-ambiance resembles it too.
author: Sara B.

description: I take all of my friends who are visiting San Francisco to this place I've been coming here for 3 years now, and the spiced ginger chai and green tea chai are my favorite. The Tofu L. T. and the Pesto Chicken and the Jalepeno bagel are my top food items. Annie, the owner, makes all the chai herself, all the tofu herself, gets to know her customers, and is genuinely a sweet lady. You will never find better chai tea! Hit this place up on a warm day in Cole Valley because sitting outside, sipping ginger chai is one of my best memories of San Francisco.
author: Majel B.

description: This cute little coffeehouse is conveniently located near the Haight, Hippie Hill, and Cole Valley.  It doesn't offer much in the way of ambiance, but its menu offerings are solid, and I've always had friendly service when I've dropped in for bagels and OJ.
author: John S.

description: Holy Tofu Sandwich. Home-made spiced tofu with lettuce and tomato with tasty sauce. I'm not even a tofu person and told the guy at the counter this, and he said I should really still try it, I would be surprised. I did, and I was, and now I am considering making the three mile bike trip there more often just to eat it. Also, both people working were super nice.
author: Laura D.

description: I'm not usually in this neighborhood, but after getting my hair cut at a new place, I thought it would be nice to soak up a new environment and find a cute little coffee/tea place with some chocolate chai. I had a craving for it. I saw La Boulange, but I have one of those near me, and it didn't have chocolate chai, so I wandered past this place, and they did. It wasn't quite what I was looking for. Small, so no people watching. The drinks come in paper disposable cups, although there are photos of pretty real cupped drinks on the wall. There were a couple other people there, and they all had paper cups too. This is cash only, but luckily I had cash. My chai was probably good..I wanted to like it. For some reason I didn't. It was too hot, which seems silly since it's supposed to be hot, but it couldn't cool down and my tongue is still burned 3 days later. I could taste that the spices were fresh - a lot of ginger, but somehow the ginger overshadowed the chocolate too much. That's just my opinion though. Any place that makes their own fresh chai is great. La Boulange would probably be more my speed, I can spend a while in there sipping my chai latte from a bowl and reading a book and watching others, so I just had unjust expectations. I left early and threw out the drink because I could only drink less than a quarter. If I lived near there, I'd definitely give it another try, they have lots of cute sandwiches, bakery goods, etc there. I'm giving it a solid A-OK.
author: Merredith L.

description: this is my favourite neighbourhood coffee joint (considering there are about a dozen neighbourhood coffee joints right around there...). The coffee is consistently good and i don't even really care for flavoured coffee all that much, but their european chocolate dutch and hazelnut flavours are amazing and smell equally as enticing. The service is always over and above friendly and sometimes i just go there to have someone behind a counter smile at me and say "have a great day, hon!" 'cuz it makes me feel as warm and fuzzy inside as much as...well, a cup of european dutch chocolate coffee does.
author: sandy o.

description: Lava Java made up for a subpar lunch with a pretty good breakfast. The whole wheat bagel was great, on the slim side so not too heavy, and inside came egg whites, tomatoes, cucumber and jam. A bit of an eclectic combination I suppose (the guy making it asked me to validate I wanted jam - you bet!), but it all came together for an excellent sandwich.
author: Jason B.

description: I love striking out on a nice day, heading straight to this cafe and then off for a walk around the park or a stroll down Haight street.  I get the green tea blast, which is a very sweet green tea soy/milkshake that looks healthy but is definitely mostly sugar.  Yes, I'm talking about the big train smoothies.  I know, they are sweet, but this place does em right!!  The woman who runs the place is always there and recognizes me no matter how long it's been since my last visit.  The breads and cookies here are homemade and just wonderful too if you're in for a treat!  This cafe is a cute, little must-try!
author: Amy M.

description: Great sandwiches and coffee, great service. The hummus veggie sandwich is fantastic. Only 4* because of the cash only policy, etc. These are the typical disadvantages of small shops. Then again, this does add a certain appeal. Overall, a very cozy coffee shop, unlike some places (Starbucks).
author: Tony G.

description: I really like this place.  We stumbled on this place this past weekend when going to Stumasa-another great find.  While looking at the art work and the prices my sister-in-law and I concluded we could sell hers so she can then decorate her living room:)  I went there yesterday too and had a nice strong cappuccino.  Going back soon for one of their yummy  veggie sandwiches that a girl next to me finished in a minute flat!
author: Shilpa K.

description: One could easily walk right by, but you'll notice the colorful sandwich board and the green curtains, maybe the cool bike shop 2 doors down. Sandwiches, smoothies and more!  It's very welcoming and comfy inside and they don't mind if you sit and read for a biit. So it's a nondescript sandwich place that's more destination. Just go try it!
author: Judy A.

description: My favorite place to get a white mocha!! I don't know what about it..but I haven't been able to find another place with a better tasting cup than Lava Java's! I used to work a block away at my family's bike shop and I used to come here almost every morning to grab my coffee and breakfast/lunch. They make bomb sandwiches but a kinda pricey for the size but was yummy and decent. They have breakfast sandwiches and also plenty of vegetarian selection for you animal lovers. But still the best white chocolate mocha u can find here! I haven't been here in yearss but I'm sure they still have the mango smoothie which is also a favorite.
author: Elaine L.

description: A good meeting point for friends who are planning to stroll through GG park or the Cole Valley or Haight/Ashbury neighborhoods. A cute, clean, early bird coffee shop.  Just a couple of blocks away from the craziness of haight street you can get a great cup of coffee and sit at their outdoor tables watching the world go by (muni buses and all).  The owners are exceptionally friendly and welcoming.
author: Maria S.

description: I only had coffee here the other day, but I was surprised at how inexpensive it was.  I ordered three drinks and it only cost six bucks and change.  One of the employees seemed a little disgruntled, complaining that "everything's a crisis, a freaking crisis..."  Not sure what that was all about, but the coffee is good and cheap, so I'd go back.
author: Jason K.

description:
The friendly staff here assured me that the Turkey Bacon sandwich is their #1 sandwich. Given their confidence in their sandwich that they had, I ordered it, and it was AWESOME! really.

They have good coffee, they also have bagels, bagel sandwiches and a cute atmosphere. A bit small but that's really the last thing that matters.

I'll try their tofu veggie sandwich next.
author: Karen J.

description: Very friendly people here.  I only come here for the sandwiches and I always get the Zesty Turkey Italian, which is great.  The owner is always trying to get me to try another sandwhich, but you know how it is when you want something specific so I always get the same sandwich.... but its a damn good sandwich.  They have some pretty good pastries and treats as well, but I try my best to stay away from those.
author: Jeff S.

description: Read the Chai's where a must try, so we ordered a Vanilla and a Ginger Spice. Both were very good. The seating is fairly limited, not a place to spend long periods of time. $0.70 extra for Soy milk seemed excessive.
author: Joseph S.

description: the turkey garlic pesto on a croissant is sooooo good!!!
author: Oliver W.

description:
I live right uptairs from this plae and i must say the owner always greets me by name and makes me feel welcome.  I think this place is the bomb.

Shawn
author: Shawn R.

description: Cozy neighborhood place with good food and friendly staff.  Really enjoy their bagel sandwiches and chai.
author: Nathan H.

description: They must not get very many personal coffee thermoses.  We came in with two pretty typical thermoses (one 8 oz, one 16 oz), and were overcharged for both (I was charged 16 oz for the 8 oz one!!).  When I realized it and asked for a refund of the difference, the cashier (the owner, I think) was quite rude about it.  She actually poured my drink into a 20 oz paper cup and then tried to convince me it was full, even though it was a couple of inches from the top of the cup!  Sheesh!  I've never had problems using my thermoses at other coffee shops.  Probably won't go back.
author: Kathleen V.

description: If you are a New York City transplant like me, you probably miss several things: thin crust pizza, perfect bagels and a coffee truck on every corner. The other thing would be a simple egg and cheese on a bagel in the morning. Now, allowing for the fact that they don't have New York bagels here, their egg and cheese bagel sandwiches almost remind me of New York. So, on a beautiful Sunday morning, grab a bagel, a cup of coffee and head out to the park.
author: Michael S.

description: Okay.  So I went here because I had a hankerin' for my new favorite coffee drink: the cafe au lait.  Mind you,  I swore off coffee for years because its acidic nature tore a birthing canal in my stomach.  Then while in Tahoe last week, a friend offered me a cup of joe and I began to reacquaint myself with the dark cousin from Sumatra.   I order an au lait from the barista: nice guy.  Fairly handsome if I remember correctly - well I'll put it this way he wasn't ugly and I wouldn't kick him put of bed.  I asked for their milk selection and settled on soy.  As he made my mid - afternoon snack I saw the bounty of pastries before me and asked if any of the items, a fat free apricot oat  thing (you know the circular kind that are usually wheat free) and a fruit granola pie looking confection particularly, were wheat -free (a boy's gotta watch his wheat and gluten intake).  Sadly the barista said he wasn't sure.  But then he suggested a bran muffin aka a wheat field wrapped in plastic wrap as an alternative because "it's the most popular."  Well buddy, if I was looking for popular pastries I would have went to The 'Buck and started my evening right with a skinny latte and a lemon bar.  Disappointed and shot down I took my au lait (yes they charge extra for soy milk like all the Nazis) and made my way to the condiment bar.  Splenda, sugar, sugar in the raw, and the blue packets whose name escapes me.  No spoons for stirring (I guess that whole recycle, reduce, reuse movement missed this block of upper haight).  However, they did have a homemade sign  (circa 2nd grade) on their napkin dispenser advising patrons to use no more than that which they need.  Even with chocolate and splenda en lieu of honey, the au lait made my taste buds go au no.
author: Eric J.

description: Up until right now I've been an avid Yelp user contributing nothing, but I love Lava Java so much I decided to finally sign up for an account and write my first review.  Lava Java has the best breakfast bagel I've found anywhere.  I'm actually sad on days that don't start with an egg and cheddar on asiago bagel sandwich.  Sometimes I get it for dinner, it's that good.  Pair that with their chocolate macadamia nut coffee and it's a good day.  The staff is super friendly and will quickly learn your name and usual order if you become an obsessed regular like me.  Just be sure to bring cash, because they don't take cards.
author: Laura M.

description: Annie is great, they like their usual customers and have even offered to let me pay the next time since they are cash only and my hangover breakfast cost more that the 5 bucks I had on me.  Good pastries, sandwiches & coffee.
author: E G.
